event.name: TECHTHRIVE 2.0: PROBLEM STATEMENTS
event.overview: The objective of TechThrive 2.0 is to build practical, technology-driven solutions that solve real-world inefficiencies faced by students, faculty, and administration within our campus.

trackA.title: Campus Event Hub
trackA.problem: Information about club events, workshops, and seminars is often scattered across WhatsApp groups and notice boards, leading to missed opportunities and low participation.
trackA.challenge: Build a centralized "Event Dashboard" where all clubs can post upcoming events.
features: Students can view a calendar of events.
Filter events by category (Technical, Cultural, Sports).
"One-Click Register" button.

trackA.title: The "On-Duty" (OD) Automator
trackA.problem: Students participating in hackathons, workshops, or sports often get marked "Absent" in regular classes because the manual OD approval process is slow or paperwork gets lost.
trackA.challenge: Create a workflow system to protect student attendance.
features: Student applies for OD for a specific event/date.
Event Organizer (Admin) approves the request digitally.
System generates a final list of "Approved ODs" for the attendance authority.

trackA.title: The "Lost & Found" Digital Board
trackA.problem: Valuable items (ID cards, chargers, bottles) lost on campus rarely find their way back to owners because physical notices are ignored.
trackA.challenge: Develop a digital, image-based Lost & Found Feed.
features: Users can upload details of found items (Photo + Location Found).
Search functionality for owners to find their lost items.
A "Claim" button to contact the finder.

trackA.title: Unified 360Â° Feedback & Grievance Portal
trackA.problem: Student feedback regarding facilities (Hostel, Mess, Buses, Canteen, Faculty, Management) is often unorganized, informal, or ignored.
trackA.challenge: Build a centralized, anonymous Grievance & Feedback System.
features: Select category (e.g., "Bus Route 5", "Canteen Hygiene", "Classroom").
Submit complaint/suggestion anonymously.
Admin View: System routes the complaint to the relevant simulated dashboard.

trackA.title: Smart Mess Waste Reduction System
trackA.problem: Hostel messes generate significant food waste due to inaccurate headcount estimates and a lack of visibility into student meal preferences.
trackA.challenge: Design a digital platform to connect student attendance, food preparation, and waste management.
features: A simple interface where students confirm or skip upcoming meals to provide an accurate headcount.
Any leftover food is automatically reported to registered NGOs or shelters for quick donation pickup.

trackA.title: "Campus Genie" - RAG-based AI Assistant
trackA.problem: Students struggle to find specific rules, exam schedules, or old circulars buried in emails or the college website.
trackA.challenge: Build an AI Chatbot using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).
features: Ingest college documents (Rulebooks, Notices, Holiday Lists).
Allow students to ask natural questions.
Bot provides accurate answers based only on uploaded documents.

trackA.title: Smart Academic Resource Sharer (AI-Enhanced)
trackA.problem: Finding quality notes and Previous Year Questions (PYQs) is difficult, and students often don't have time to read full documents.
trackA.challenge: Design a peer-to-peer Notes Repository with AI capabilities.
features: Upload/Download functionality for notes (sorted by Subject/Semester).
AI generates Summary or Short Quiz when a PDF is uploaded.

trackA.title: AI-Based Attendance System (With Validation Feature)
trackA.problem: Traditional attendance methods are time-consuming, prone to proxy attendance, and lack real-time validation and centralized tracking.
trackA.challenge: Design a secure AI-based attendance system.
features: AI-powered face recognition to automatically mark attendance and Validation to prevent proxy attendance.
Real-time database update with student-wise and class-wise records.
Dashboard to view, export, and validate attendance reports.

trackA.title: Blockchain Certificate Validator
trackA.problem: Verifying the authenticity of participation certificates or event winners is difficult, leading to possible forgeries.
features: Issue certificates as digital assets recorded on a blockchain.
Unique Hash ID or QR Code for every certificate.
Verification page to confirm authenticity.

trackB.title: Open Innovation: Smart Campus
trackB.description: If your team has a unique idea that fits the "Smart Campus" theme but isn't listed above, you may choose this track.
requirements: You must define a clear problem statement related to campus life.
The solution must use technology (AI, Web, App, or Automation).
The solution must reduce manual effort or improve efficiency.
